page.title: 17Forest Sheep in Parkend
page.content: Many visitors to the Forest of Dean find it strange to see so many sheep roaming free on the roads.Any Forester who owns enough land to husband his sheep in the winter has the right to let his sheep roam free.All the sheep are now marked so that they can be easily recognised.A group of people called "The Commoners' Association"looks after the rights of the Commoner,which includes the right to allow sheep to roam.To register as a Commoner ,one must have been born within the "Hundred of St.Briavels which is a parculiar area within the Forest.The rights of the Commoner go back hundreds of years.
